clinical_study.brief_title: Cerebral Small Vessel Disease Registry Study
clinical_study.official_title: Cerebral Small Vessel Disease Registry Study
clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital of Fujian Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to determine the clinical spectrum and natural progression of Cerebral Small Vessel Disease (CSVD) and in a prospective multicenter study, to assess the clinical, genetic and epigenetic features of patients with CSVD, , to find independent imaging markers, and to optimize clinical management.

primary_outcome.measure: Overall outcomes in patients with cerebral small vessel disease.
primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of enrollment until the date of death from any cause, assessed up to 30 years
primary_outcome.description: record the occurrence of stroke and use modified Rankin Scale (mRS) to measure the degree of disability or dependence in the daily activities of people who have suffered a stroke or other causes of neurological disability.

secondary_outcome.measure: the development of the burden of microbleeds in MRI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of enrollment until the date of death from any cause, assessed up to 30 years
secondary_outcome.description: using MARS scale to evaluate the development of the burden of microbleeds

secondary_outcome.measure: the development of the burden of white matter hypertension in MRI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of enrollment until the date of death from any cause, assessed up to 30 years
secondary_outcome.description: using Fazakes scale to evaluate the development of the burden of white matter hypertension

secondary_outcome.measure: the development of lacunes in MRI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of enrollment until the date of death from any cause, assessed up to 30 years
secondary_outcome.description: record the number and location of lacunes

secondary_outcome.measure: the development of enlarged perivascular space in MRI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of enrollment until the date of death from any cause, assessed up to 30 years
secondary_outcome.description: record the number and location of enlarged perivascular space

study_pop.textblock: Patient who are diagnosed as Cerebral Small Vessel Disease

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Sign informed consent.
2. Age>18
3. At least one of the following CSVD MRI characteristics: ①recent small subcortical infarct;②lacune of presumed vascular origin;③white matter hypertensity of presumed vascular origin;④perivascular space;⑤cerebral microbleeds;⑥brain atrophy
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Unable to cooperate with inspectors
2. Non-vascular white matter lesions
3. Other cognitive diseases (such as alzheimer's disease, Parkinson's disease or thyroid disease)
4. Serious systemic illness, such as heart, liver, kidney disease or major mental illness
5. Contraindications for imaging examination
